basics.name: Anna Logan McClendon
basics.label: NSF Fellow
basics.summary: A second-year Master's student at the University of Michigan School for Environment and Sustainability who is interested in the application of nature-based solutions for flood mitigation in the coastal Southeast.

Professional Experience.name: Robinson Design Engineers, Charleston, SC
highlights: Ran semi-automated algorithm in MATLAB to extract tidal creek parameters using LiDAR data

Calculated parameters such as sinuosity, drainage density, and overmarsh path length of tidal creek reference systems to inform the design of a 7 acre salt marsh restoration project in collaboration with the SC Department of Natural Resources
Developed theoretical green roof hydrology model to understand their potential for flood mitigation in the Southeast

Professional Experience.name: Robinson Design Engineers, Charleston, SC
highlights: Computed hydrologic/hydraulic design calculations for various stormwater control measures using WINTR-55 and HEC-RAS
Produced ArcGIS storymap to relay information to a homeowner's association about nature-based stormwater management practices within their neighborhood
Created graphic materials for a petition to save Gadsden Creek, one of the last remaining tidal creeks on the Charleston peninsula, from development

Professional Experience.name: Clemson Computing and Information Technology, Clemson, SC
highlights: Constructed ArcGIS Hub using interactive data dashboards for Fire and Emergency Medical Services
Hosted a GIS day event including a humanitarian map-a-thon, guest speakers, and map-making competitions

Professional Experience.name: Clemson University Baruch Institute of Coastal Ecology and Forest Science
highlights: Evaluated priority areas for microbial source tracking to identify water contaminant sources in the Edisto Island Watershed
Drafted map layouts for use in the published watershed plan, public website, and educational outreach materials

Academic Experience.organization: Development of a nature-based solutions (NBS) database in South Carolina
Academic Experience.position: National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship
highlights: Created database of 190+ NBS case studies throughout the entire state to store information about their location, scale, benefits aimed to achieve, cost, funding sources, permit/maintenance information, and challenges faced
Produced ArcGIS storymap to make information publicly accessible to SC practitioners and residents who are interested in implementing NBS in their communities
Analyzing how the spatial distribution of NBS sites correlates with the hydrologic connectivity, landscape diversity, and carbon storage potential of their watersheds

Academic Experience.organization: Resilient stormwater management design for Mexico Beach, Florida
highlights: Calculated hydrologic parameters and developed hydraulic design for a wet detention pond
Developed visual renderings of our design for a town affected by extreme coastal flooding

Academic Experience.organization: Environment Sustainability and Geographic Information Systems (GIS)
highlights: Studied aspects of sustainability in Pamplona, Spain using life cycle assessments (LCA) and GIS
Enhanced Spanish language skills through immersion in a town with few English speakers

education.institution: University of Michigan School for Environment and Sustainability
courses: Analysis and Modeling of Environmental Data
Minors in Mathematical Sciences and Sustainability

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
